title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 July 2013 - XWiki
content:
<jbwiv> has quit  
00:36 <cjd\_> has quit  
07:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <abusenius> has quit  
08:12 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

09:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <sburjan> has quit  
09:30 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <vmassol> good morning  
09:35 <vmassol> FYI mflorea is starting the release  
09:36 <mflorea> yes, on stable-5.1.x branch  
09:37 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:02 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:12 <sburjan> has quit  
11:13 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <vmassol> FYI we're reducing unit tests % on commons on 30 days: http://sonar.xwiki.org/dashboard/index/1?did=1&period=3  
11:14 <vmassol> 42.4% on new code added in the last 30 days vs 54.2% global  
11:14 <vmassol> (IT % is growing though)  
11:15 <vmassol> just for 17 lines of code more apparently  
11:15 <tmortagne> depend what this percentage means, there is a lot of indirect testing in EM for example  
11:15 <vmassol> yes that's IT  
11:15 <vmassol> unit test means tests in one module  
11:15 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <vmassol> only affeting that module  
11:15 <vmassol> \*affecting  
11:16 <tmortagne> what are the modules lowering the most the global percent ?  
11:16 <vmassol> I'm not sure we can see that  
11:16 <vmassol> but we do have our TPC% in our poms  
11:17 <vmassol> so it's easy to extract them  
11:17 <vmassol> I had this before: http://massol.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/MaxCloverTPCTip  
11:19 <tmortagne> http://sonar.xwiki.org/drilldown/measures/1?&highlight=it\_line\_coverage&metric=it\_uncovered\_lines  
11:20 <tmortagne> that gives us number of uncoverd lines  
11:20 <tmortagne> per folder and per package it seems  
11:20 <tmortagne> and class too  
11:21 <tmortagne> but not the ercentage  
11:21 <tmortagne> percentage  
11:21 <vmassol> indeed it's a good indicator already  
11:21 <vmassol> for unit tests too: http://sonar.xwiki.org/drilldown/measures/1?highlight=line\_coverage&metric=uncovered\_lines  
11:22 <tmortagne> yes this link is better that's the one I was searching for actually  
11:22 <vmassol> the thing is that I didn't write a lot of unit tests for test frameworks  
11:22 <vmassol> because I know they are tested indirectly by our usage  
11:23 <vmassol> we can decide if we want to add unit etsts for them  or not  
11:23 <vmassol> in practice it's not terribly useful but why not  
11:23 <vmassol> the classloader module is not well tested  
11:23 <vmassol> the reason is that we copied code  
11:24 <vmassol> (AFAIR)  
11:24 <vmassol> (not that it is an excuse)  
11:24 <tmortagne> ReflectionUtils direct test coverage should be improved but it's probably 100% indirect coverage with other modules tests  
11:48 <chalx> has quit  
12:03 <Slashman> has quit  
12:15 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <vmassol> tmortagne: fyi, just ran it: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/5956349/raw/7df7f438f7eb886559b37a6c36429e524bfbcf2e/gistfile1.txt  
12:30 <vmassol> just updated it: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/5956349/raw/f9a798a311cd20213b2be2fabb4b998f99e4502d/gistfile1.txt  
12:30 <vmassol> so we have 6 modules with low percentage coverage  
12:31 <vmassol> hmm I think there's a bug with jacoco, fixing  
12:40 <vmassol> yeah the problem is all modules that have 0% coverage  
12:40 <vmassol> https://github.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/81
